newsitem.title: USA: Heavy late buying of CBOT corn put options noted.
newsitem.headline: Heavy late buying of CBOT corn put options noted.

text.p: Heavy buying of Chicago Board of Trade corn put options during the last 15 minutes of trading helped to spark weakness in futures, pit sources said.

Smith Barney bought an estimated 5,000 corn puts in the last few minutes, sources said. They said the company bought 2,000 lots of May $3.20 puts at a premium of 55-1/2 to 57 cents, 2,000 lots of May $3.00 puts for 34-1/2 to 35-1/2 cents and 1,000 lots of July $3.20 puts at 52 cents.

The move was perceived as bearish and sparked late selling in futures, several sources noted. May corn futures closed 1-3/4 cents lower at $2.65-3/4 a bushel and July ended off 1-1/4 cents at $2.68-1/4.
